div.l: Yif euer sithen / I hihte hogge of ware
Herde I bettir millere set a werke
He hadde a iape / of malys in the derke
aBut god forbede / that we stynten heere
cA tale of me / that am a pore man
bAnd therefor / yf ye vouchesaff to heere
dI wol you telle / as wel as euer I Can
A litel Iape / that fil in our Cite
Our host / Answerde / ⁊and seyde I gr̄ awteg awtegr̄awte the
Now telle on rogere / look that it be good
For many a pasty / hast thou leten blood
And many a Iakke / of douyr hast thou sold
That hath be twyes hot / ⁊and twyes cold
Of many a pilgrym / hast thou crystis curs
For of the persely / yit fare they the wors
That they eet / with the stubbid gos
For in the shoppe / goth many a flye los
Now telle on gentil / Roger bi thi name
But yit I pray the / be nat wroth for game
A man may say ful soth / in game ⁊and play
Thou saist ful soth / qduod Rogeere bi my fay
But soth play quade spel / the flemmyng sayth
And therfore bailyf / bi thi faith
Be thou nat wroth / er we departen heere
Thouh that my tale / be of an hosteleere
But natheles / I wol nat telle It yit
But er we parte / I wis thou shalt be quyt
And ther withal he lowh / and maad good cheere
And seide his tale / as ye shal after heere
A Prentys whilom / dwelt in our cite
And of a craft / of vitilers was he
Gailard he was / as goldfynch / in the shawe
Broıı̄un as a berye / a propre short felawe
With lokkes blake / kempt ful fetisly
Daıı̄unce he cowde / so wel and Iolily
That he was clepid / perkyn the revelour
He was as ful of love / and paramour
